Ratings.comment: I have a disability and she was very disrespectful and awful about it, they also made me very uncomfortable on multiple occasions with the way they spoke to me. Avoid her if you have any kind of disability, She is also terrible with accommodations pertaining to mental health, and can be pretty nasty to students.
chooses to not care about students struggling about mental health

Professor Sims is very passionate about what she teaches, and you can tell by her lectures. If you are interested in the content of the class, she is wonderful. If you are just taking it for a GE credit, you may not like the lectures as much. Participation in lectures was important every day.

Sims is not accommodating when it comes to absences, illnesses, etc. She is very strict to the syllabus, difficult to approach, and not flexible. Made me feel like she was doing me a favor when I requested more than reasonable accommodations. She is very intelligent, but I wouldnt take another course with her. Only Slavic prof I wouldnt recommend

Dr. Sims has a vast wealth of knowledge on the subject, and it's obvious that the lectures barely scratch the surface despite the density. Her required readings are difficult, but not horrible once you get into the rhythm. She relishes in questions in class, and will launch into immensely informative tangents. 10/10, would recommend

Professor Sims is really knowledgable of Slavic studies. She is an anthropologist which adds to it. Her class is definitely geared for upperclassmen and I don't recommend it for GE credits or underclassmen. It is also a thinking/comprehension class, not really about memorizing material. Be prepared to be called on and work hard for the grade.

Professor Sims is one of the best professors I've ever had. Not only is she absolutely brilliant, but she is an extremely skilled instructor. You will work hard, yes, so if you're not willing to put in the work don't bother, but if you do, it's so worth it. She's amazing!

She is a very intelligent women. If your major is Linguists or Slavic languages, I would recommend her. If you are taking her as a GE class Professor, I wouldn't advise it. She treats everyone in the class like they're taking this as a major class, and makes it hard to comprehend and understand a lot of things. The class was also boring and dry.

Dr. Sims is great at engaging the class. Her discussions are always interesting and do not feel like they are too controlled by the student or the professor. I appreciate the balance. She gives plenty of extra credit, not too much homework, and the quizzes aren't too bad either. The semester long project was a bummer though.

So knowledgable and enthusiastic and facilitates great discussion in class. Very passionate about what she does and available to help students often. Lots of material covered and fairly heavy papers/projects, but if you put in the effort and pay attention it's a very enjoyable course.

Great professor. Very enthusiastic and knowledgable. Heavy workload for the GE credit, but not too unbearable. She is pretty approachable, and worked with my schedule to accommodate meeting me outside of class. I would definitely take a class with her again. Be prepared to do a lot of reading, with occasional pop quizzes.
Very nice person, tough material. Uses big words and strong vocabulary makes it tough to keep along with lecture.
Simply one of the best professors I've ever had. A total powehouse. Extremely interesting class very well taught.
Took as a GEC class, ended up super interested! lots of discussion, she leads you to her points, very helpful!

Andrea is very skilled at walking people through theory, and she cares about helping people get through the material. Her labs are useful and related, and she stimulates a lot of conversation based on the book.

I have a disability and she was very disrespectful and awful about it, they also made me very uncomfortable on multiple occasions with the way they spoke to me. Avoid her if you have any kind of disability, She is also terrible with accommodations pertaining to mental health, and can be pretty nasty to students.
chooses to not care about students struggling about mental health

Professor Sims is very passionate about what she teaches, and you can tell by her lectures. If you are interested in the content of the class, she is wonderful. If you are just taking it for a GE credit, you may not like the lectures as much. Participation in lectures was important every day.

Only Slavic prof I wouldnt recommend

Be prepared to be called on and work hard for the grade.

She treats everyone in the class like they're taking this as a major class, and makes it hard to comprehend and understand a lot of things. The class was also boring and dry.

She gives plenty of extra credit, not too much homework, and the quizzes aren't too bad either. The semester long project was a bummer though.

She is pretty approachable, and worked with my schedule to accommodate meeting me outside of class. I would definitely take a class with her again. Be prepared to do a lot of reading, with occasional pop quizzes.
Very nice person, tough material. Uses big words and strong vocabulary makes it tough to keep along with lecture.
Simply one of the best professors I've ever had. A total powehouse. Extremely interesting class very well taught.
Took as a GEC class, ended up super interested! lots of discussion, she leads you to her points, very helpful!

Andrea is very skilled at walking people through theory, and she cares about helping people get through the material. Her labs are useful and related, and she stimulates a lot of conversation based on the book.

(Swedish 1101-1103) Agi is a wonderful teacher, and I am so grateful to have learned from her. She is one professor who genuinely cares about her students and is willing to go the extra mile. I can say this class was definitely the highlight of my day. With that said, be prepared to actively participate every class.
Took 1101-1103. Plenty of homework, but almost none is graded, still should do though, often gone over in class. Great professor, very friendly, sometimes may expect a bit much from students.

A truly wonderful human being. You don't feel like you are in a class but having a meeting with friends. Leave your phone in your pocket. She does not like phone usage in class. I am taking the Swedish series at OSU and am so happy I have her as my instructor. She is truly a treasure.

Agi is a wonderful human. She is so sweet and really just wants you to do well. If you ever need help with anything, don't hesitate to ask, but she really does go above and beyond to make sure everyone is learning and keeping up. Brings snacks pretty much every Friday and she loves to find ways to make class fun. Plus Swedish is SO easy!

This is a very involved class, but Agi is a wonderful teacher. She is very kind and teaches Swedish very well. There is a lot of work involved in this class, like any language, but you can leave this class being fairly proficient in Swedish

Hungarian is a difficult language to learn, but Agi made it so much less daunting-- she is so kind, helpful, and positive. If you show up and put in some effort, expect to be rewarded with food, gifts, jokes, parties and games. Take any class with her (she also teaches a Hungarian culture class, among others) and you will be glad you did.

Agi is Awesome! She is probably the sweetest person you will ever meet. Even if you have no interest in the Hungarian language you should take her class just so you can have her as your teacher. She will go to the end of the world to help you, immerse you in Hung. culture and knowledge and she will even bake for you! I love her!!

Very kind, entertaining, and well-organized instructor who was excellent at conveying the course content and did so in involved and exciting ways. Though there was homework every night, it was weighed fairly and did cover the course content well. Great experience overall.

She never answer my email. I have a trouble of connection when I take the exam, finally I felt it but I ask her if I can redo it. She didnt answer me. She said Retaking an exam that is multiple choice is against university rules, for good reason, I should contact an technical support but she said, she cant do any on it, I just felt it .please dont

She never answer my email. I have a trouble of connection when I take the exam, finally I felt it but I ask her if I can redo it. She didnt answer me. She said Retaking an exam that is multiple choice is against university rules, for good reason, I should contact an technical support but she said, she cant do any on it, I just felt it .

I decided to take her class as a GE to fulfill a visual and performing arts class because I had heard good things about the class, but that was when there was a different professor. Her tests are completely subjective to what her opinions are and if you dont remember tiny details from the readings/movies, youre screwed on a 1/4 of the test.
She does not provide the discussion participation grades. The exam questions were very subjective and were very misleading. She is probably one of the worst professors I've had at OSU.

She refused to provide our discussion participation grades, which was 20% of our grade. Students could not know how they were doing in the class. Exam heavy, they were all multiple choice opinions. so you had to pay attention to her opinions and memorize them to get answers right.

Awful experience. Never responded to emails. The class was supposed to be over zoom but she changed it last second. The tests are next to impossible and have multiple choice opinion questions. All of the other questions are worded in gibberish. She makes no sense and shes rude in everything shes said. Dont take.

Helena was absolutely great for Russian Film. I really enjoyed her insights and the films she picked. She is one of my favorite teachers in the Russian department. She genuinely cares about student success.

Is a very nice woman and clearly enjoys teaching. The exams and quizzes are relatively easy (as long as you're going to class) but participation is 25% of your grade so you need to make sure you speak and she knows your name. In my experience is bad at responding to emails

She's very entertaining and interesting in lecture. She's also quite witty. She did seem, however, to pick favorites based on participation. If you don't speak up in class, she'll eventually call you out. Her quiz questions were very subjective, in my opinion. I did almost all the readings and still struggled with her little 5 point quizzes.

Helena was a great teacher who was always full of energy and enthusiasm during her lectures. While the tests are tough, she's always willing to help the people who participate a lot in her class. She gives "pop" quizzes, but always told us the class beforehand if she was going to quiz us over certain material. Good class, but you have to work hard!

A very nice, funny lady. It's one of those classes that you can't really study for. Pay attention to what she says in class and hope you remember everything. The films weren't very good, and she posts long readings to do on carmen (which I didn't do). But she's very animated so the class is kinda fun.

Class was graded on 3 exams 8 quizzes and particpation. She says she gives pop quizzes, but she will tell you the class before if she is giving one. The quizzes are based on readings and films. You have to write down everything she says to do well on the exams and readings are really long, but the class is not too bad. Also, shes very funny.

Absolutely loved this class! Such a worthwhile GEC...so glad I took it! Helena is a fantastic woman- she is hilarious, always makes class interesting, is extremely approachable, and encourages class discussion. The movies she chose were really good and relevant and tests were not hard at all. I highly recommend this class to everyone!

She is hilarious and so knowledgeable. Tests were multiple choice and she encouraged a lot of class participation and discussion but also provided an alternative way to earn participation points which was great. I'm glad I chose it as my GEC. She is an awesome professor!

Prof. Goscilo is full of sarcasm and wit which makes class very enjoyable to go to. The movies she chooses are enjoyable and discussions are generally lively. She truly creates an environment where you can feel comfortable interacting with her and other students. A very worthwhile GEC.

Amazing professor. Razor sharp woman with a sense of humor. Would recommend for any class, especially Russian Folklore. Took the time to confront the obnoxious pack of girls chattering at the back of a packed lecture hall, much to mine (and everyone else's) delight. In a GEC class of 70, no easy feat.
